references.paper_title: Semi-supervised classification with graph convolutional networks
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the field of graph convolutional networks (GCNs), introducing the core architecture and methodology that many subsequent GCNs are based upon.

references.paper_title: Inductive representation learning on large graphs
references.reason: This paper introduced an inductive approach to graph representation learning, critical for handling large and unseen graph data, a significant contribution to the field.

references.paper_title: Deep residual learning for image recognition
references.reason: This paper's introduction of residual connections dramatically improved the training of deep convolutional neural networks (CNNs), a concept generalized to Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Learning convolutional neural networks for graphs
references.reason: This paper pioneered the application of convolutional architectures to graph data, a crucial step that the current paper further develops and improves upon.
This paper introduced attention mechanisms to graph neural networks, significantly enhancing their performance and expressiveness, becoming a widely adopted GNN model.
